comments.body: @deven-amd please check if these logging changes are truly required in this PR

they are not a must for this PR, but they do fix a bug in this file (and hence filed as a separate commit)

without that change, we will get the following error in the test output

```

Message: 'avg_pool gradient error = '                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Arguments: (9.5367431640625e-07,)               

```

The above error does not seem to prevent the corresponding subtests from "passing", and hence fixing it is not a "must". Also this error does not seem to be ROCm specific...guessing it is an issue on other platforms too.
thanks for the clarification. could you revise the description of the PR then?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1015,1019 @@          x_init_value=x_init_value,
          delta=1e-2)
    tf_logging.info("%s gradient error = %.4f" % (func_name, err))
    self.assertLess(err, err_tolerance)

comments.body: I think these configs should be namedtuples; this way they'll be self-documenting
Now that you have a namedtuple you can use kwargs here to make it prettier

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +846,850 @@        ['use_gpu', 'include_batch_in_index', 'argmax'])
    configs = [
        Config(False, False, [0, 1, 3, 5, 0, 2, 6, 8]),
        Config(False, True, [0, 1, 3, 5, 9, 11, 15, 17]),
        Config(True, False, [0, 1, 3, 5, 0, 2, 6, 8]),

comments.body:
This is broken, should be:
 `tf_logging.info("%s gradient error = %.4f" % (func_name, err))`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +948,952 @@          x_init_value=x_init_value,
          delta=1e-2)
    tf_logging.info("%s gradient error = " % func_name, err)
    self.assertLess(err, err_tolerance)

comments.body:
Should be:
`tf_logging.info("%s second-order gradient error = %.4f" % (func_name, err))`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1025,1029 @@          x_init_value=x_init_value,
          delta=1e-2)
    tf_logging.info("%s second-order gradient error = " % func_name, err)
    self.assertLess(err, err_tolerance)

comments.body: In both cases, remove this env-var setting at the end of the test so it has no effect on other tests.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1367,1371 @@
    # Propagate the diff in cases of NaNs
    os.environ["TF_ENABLE_MAXPOOL_NANPROP"] = "1"
    expected_input_backprop_cudnn = expected_input_backprop_tf_cpu

comments.body:
This is broken. The test names are not unique and therefore only one of the possible tests will get run. This should set a test name that is a concatenation of all the test params. I also recommend using a function like 

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/matmul_op_test.py#L35

to add the tests so this will not happen in the future.
`GetShrunkInceptionMaxPoolShapes` returns unique name for each parameters test combination, so it should be okay.
